author: Special Correspondent
text:
Inspector General Satya Prakash Sharma, the Eastern Regional Commander, has become the first officer in the Indian Coast Guard to be awarded the President's Tatrakshak Medal twice.

According to an official release from the Defence Ministry on Monday, the President approved the Bar to the President's Tatrakshak's Medal to Mr. Sharma on the occasion of the Republic Day for his meritorious service. Mr. Sharma has won the Tatrakshak Medal in 1996 and the President's Tatrakshak Medal in 2008.

The medal would be bestowed upon the officer during the next investiture ceremony. Mr. Sharma is also the senior most officer in the rank of Inspector General in the Coast Guard.
title: First Coast Guard officer to get medal twice
